clinical_study.brief_title: Forecast Number of Covid-19 Cases Worldwide
clinical_study.official_title: Time Series Model For Forecasting the Number of Covid-19 Cases Worldwide - A Prospective Cohort Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Turkish Ministry of Health Izmir Teaching Hospital

clinical_study.source: Turkish Ministry of Health Izmir Teaching Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Coronavirus disease-19 (Covid-19) had an unprecedented effect on both nations and health systems. Time series modeling using Auto-Regressive Integrated Moving Averages (ARIMA) models have been used to forecast variables extensively mainly in statistics and econometrics. The investigators aimed to predict the total number of cases for Covid-19 using ARIMA models of time-series analysis.

detailed_description.textblock:
Coronavirus Disease 19 (Covid-19) is an infectious disease initially defined in December 2019 before becoming pandemic. Respiratory disease is the main form of disease causing acute respiratory distress as the main cause of death.
Increased number of cases worldwide had put an enormous load on public health resulting lockdowns, quarantines and curfews. Predicting number of cases is hard as the increment of cases between communities differ.
Time series had been used in different fields of science to predict, such as signal processing, mathematical finance, weather prediction. In medicine, time series analysis were used in number of admitted patients to hospitals. Aim of this study is to predict the total number of Covid-19 cases worldwide using time series anaylsis.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Confirmed cases of Covid-19

arm_group.description: Number of Covid-19 cases from December 31, 2019 to June 1, 2020 were used to build ARIMA model using Hyndman-Khandakar algorithm.
Number of Covid-19 cases from June 2, 2020 to June 15, 2020 were used to forecast cases using the ARIMA model

study_pop.textblock: Population consists all confirmed cases of Covid-19 reported from Situation Dashboard of the European Center for Disease Prevention and Control website Coronavirus 19 Situation Report

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Confirmed case of Covid-19
Exclusion Criteria:
- Cases not reported
